intro: Erythraea texensis, commonly known as Texas erythranthe, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Erythraea texensis is often found in prairies and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
